alert.note: Alert for Casey (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 6:19PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT EAST CENTRAL RUSSELL AND SOUTHEASTERN CASEY COUNTIES THROUGH 645 PM EDT/545 PM CDT/... At 619 PM EDT/519 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Liberty, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Liberty, Mintonville, Lawhorn Hill, Windsor, Teddy, Gilpin, Bethelridge, Rubert Ford, Lanhamtown and Cantown. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
